messages.message:
Brian
I stopped going to Impact Church because my pastor Travis told me I'm not allowed to use the word Karma.  I find this to be intolerant.
Did the pastor explain why he objected to the word?

Hmm, that's kind of a cold way of putting it.  Here's the deal:  it's not that it's a swear word or anything, but it does stir up images of people getting what they deserve, or that if you do enough good then good things will happen or you or that God will be pleased with you for it.  That's where Christians would disagree.  We recognize that we don't get what we deserve (which is death and hell) but instead God looks at us and gives us what in fact we don't deserve, life, and we receive this as a gift and not because we were nice enough to the right people.  That's probably what the pastor meant though I do think he should have taken the time to explain it with you.

Brian
That is profoundly insightful.  I knew from your FB post you would be able to help.  Interesting the stigmatism attached to that word.  My wife has always used it to mean only a good thing, "do good things and good things will come back to you"  What is the biblical reference to that idea?

Good question since it really isn't biblical, it's more in line with Buddhism and Hinduism that if you do enough good deeds you will be rewarded and elevated to a higher life form the next time around.

Brian
Isn't there a reference to "Do unto others as they do unto you"  Maybe that is old testament?
Jesus mentions that in the gospels.

Just a sec
Looks like Matthew 7: 12 and Luke 6: 31

Brian
Awesome!  I'll start there.  Isn't those concepts similar to karma?  Why wouldn't doing bad unto others and they do bad unto you be interpreted the same way?
P.S. The Jews have their own version and it is admittedly more violent.
Anyway I have to get going soon, hope this helps!
